subject: Call of Cthulhu updates, with notes on Quikscript on the Web
msgSnippet: I ve updated . The most notable change is that I ve stuck html { /* … */ text-rendering:
messageBody:
I've updated <http://adiabatic.github.io/qs-literature/call-of-cthulhu/>. The most notable change is that I've stuck

html {
/* … */
text-rendering: optimizeLegibility;
}

in the CSS. This enables kerned pairs so UTTER MAY doesn't look like utter garbage. If you're using Kingsley on the Web, I *highly* recommend turning this on. I haven't checked for the presence of kerning pairs in other fonts — namely Thoth and Jerome.
